result.execSummary:
The defendant Terry W Crawford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Atty D. Burke

Upon recommendation that the defendant be terminated from the Bail Monitoring Program, court ordered Arrest Warrant be issued and once in custody, defendant's cash bail be reinstated in the amt of $1,500 per case for a total of $1,500. BMP is removed as a condition. All other previous bail conditions remain set.  Arrest warrant issued.  Original and copy of warrant to DCSO.  Copy for file.
Referral to BMP
Preliminary hearing at 09-17-2015 08:30 am

- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $1500.00 (per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Patricia L. or Kelsey V.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.  
Defendant did not waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge - Br 5

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Stephanie R Hilton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
